titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Eugene Frederick Quinn papers, 1822-2005
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Harold P. Anderson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-01-08T11:09-0800

change.item: Declassified series added to collection, box 17 (apparent increment) described, and biographical note written by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Elizabeth Phillips.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Eugene Frederick Quinn Papers)//EN" "quinneuf.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: Eugene Frederick Quinn papers

physdesc.extent: 18 manuscript boxes, 3 microfilm reels, 2 envelopes, 1 expanding folder, 4 sound tape reels

did.abstract: Research notes and drafts, lists, writings, interviews, copies of government documents, printed matter, tapes of tribal chants, memorabilia, and photographs relating to the Beti society of Cameroon. Many of these documents were used by E. F. Quinn as research material for his dissertation, entitled "Changes in Beti Society, 1887-1960" (University of California, Los Angeles, 1970). Entire collection also available on microfilm (7 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Eugene Frederick Quinn papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1972.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Collection is also available on microfilm (7 reels).

MA, Modern European History, University of California, Los Angeles

Author, The Sum of All Heresies: The Image of Islam in Western Thought
Author, Welcoming the Interfaith Future: Religious Pluralism in a Global Age

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of Collection
scopecontent.p: Research notes and drafts, lists, writings, interviews, copies of government documents, printed matter, tapes of tribal chants, memorabilia, and photographs relating to the Beti society of Cameroon. Many of these documents were used by E. F. Quinn as research material for his dissertation, entitled "Changes in Beti Society, 1887-1960" (University of California, Los Angeles, 1970).

did.unittitle: PROJECT FILE FOR BETI SOCIETY STUDY,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, drafts, research notes, outlines, resumes, and bibliographies related to Frederick Quinn's project to write a history of Beti society in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries. The history is an unpublished dissertation, entitled "Changes in Beti Society, 1887-1960" (University of California, Los Angeles, 1970). See box 17 for a bound copy of the dissertation.

did.unittitle: Project correspondence
General

Zoa, Jean, Archbishop of Yaounde, Cameroun,

Notes
General
Notecards
Notebooks
Bibliographies
Resumes
Outlines, chronological and topical
Miscellaneous
CHRONOLOGICAL SERIES,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photoprints, photocopies, and typewritten transcripts of documents in the British Public Record Office, the Cameroun National Archives, and the Institut de Recherches scientifiques du Cameroun, and photoprints and photocopies of selected pages of French and German publications, collected by Quinn during the 1960s, arranged chronologically by date of document or publication, with undated documents contained in the folders marked undated. A partial list of documents and publications contained in the 1916-1950 folders, prepared by Quinn, is contained in the first folder.
See also: Declassified U.S. Government Records, 2016 January release of records.

did.unittitle: Talinde. "Quelques fÃ©tiches des Ewondo (Fetishes of the Ewondo)"
COLLECTED UNPUBLISHED WRITINGS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holographs, typescripts, transcripts, photoprints, photocopies, and carbon copies of unpublished writings in English, French, and Ewondo, for the most part prepared or collected in response to inquiries made by Quinn among the inhabitants of the Yaounde Region of the Cameroun, arranged alphabetically by author or title.

scopecontent.p: Transcripts, photoprints, photocopies, offprints, resumes, and translations of periodical literature, books, and other printed matter in English, French, German, and Ewondo, collected by Quinn, in part from the London Library of the Royal Geographic Society, arranged alphabetically by author or title.

Miscellaneous

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopies of exerpts from unidentified published matter, as well as printouts from websites of biographical statements of individuals associated with Cameroon.

did.unittitle: Photographs,
Hubert Onana,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Beti headman ( mie dzala) and cocoa planter. Onana knew Charles Atangana and many Beti chiefs of the German and French periods. The stocking cap he is wearing in some of the photos was a symbol of authority.

did.unittitle: AbbÃ© ThÃ©odore Tsala,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Beti scholar and clergyman who published works on Beti folklore, history, and language.

did.unittitle: Scenes from Cameroon,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes depictions of unidentified individuals and buildings.

did.unittitle: Photos used for published works,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typed list of descriptions/captions written by Quinn.

did.unittitle: Negatives and miscellany,
MICROFILM SERIES,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Microfilm (negative) strips (3 reels and 1 envelope) of handwritten and typewritten archival documents, unpublished writings, periodical literature, and portions of books in English, French, German, and Ewondo, dealing with African history, and in part, reproduced in other series of this collection.

did.unittitle: SOUND RECORDINGS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Four sound tape reels of Beti tribal chants.

did.unittitle: MEMORABILIA,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thin piece of colored market cloth (in expanding folder), portraying standing figure of Charles Atangana, used by the Beti.

did.unittitle: PHOTOGRAPHS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 38 prints and 1 postcard. See also: Increment, Photographs (boxes 17-18).

did.unittitle: 3 photos of Ahmadou Ahidjo, President of the Cameroun, with Frederick Quinn; 1 photo of Charles Atangana; 1 photo of Felix Essomba; 33 photos and 1 postcard depicting everyday scenes in the lives of the inhabitants of the Cameroun,
DECLASSIFIED U.S. GOVERNMENT RECORDS,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes some interfiled, unclassified government records. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

did.unittitle: 2016 January release of records,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photoprints of documents that originated with the French Colonial administration and U.N. trusteeship, but were apparently copied in the Cameroun National Archives after Cameroun independence, 1960-1961. These documents originally were in the Chronological Series.
